item.name: Create Ocean Freight Booking

exec: //Reserved for Qualified trackingIds add and deletion test
var utcD = new Date(Date.UTC(d.getFullYear(), d.getMonth(), d.getDate() + 1, "13"));

body.raw:
<SOAP-ENV:Envelope xmlns:SOAP-ENV="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:SOAP-ENC="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">

                <SenderBusinessSystemID>QM7_910</SenderBusinessSystemID>

            <TransportationOrderGenericTrackedProcess actionCode="04" changeOrdinalNumberValue="1">

                <TransportationStage>
                    <ID>10</ID>

request.description:
#### Changing Carrier or Shipper
---
Carrier and shipper can be changed from environment variables. For carrier we have `CARRIER_LBN` variable and for shipper we have `SHIPPER_LBN_ID` variable.

#### Changing Source and Destination locations
---
**Source Location:** In the XML payload we have a property called `<MainLoadingLocation>` which contains the details of the location.
- `<InternalID>`: value comes from the variable `SOURCE_LOC_EXT_ID` and `DEST_LOC_EXT_ID` maintained in environment variable. Make sure the environment variable's value get changed because it is reused while posting events.
- `<Address>`: this field needs to be filled manually while changing locations.
**Destination Location:** In the XML payload we have a property called `<MainUnloadingLocation>` which contains the details of the location.
- `<InternalID>`: value comes from the variable `SOURCE_LOC_EXT_ID` and `DEST_LOC_EXT_ID` maintained in environment variable. Make sure the environment variable's value get changed because it is reused while posting events.
- `<Address>`: this field needs to be filled manually while changing locations.

***NOTE***: If location is not present in location master app it will be created when the FO will be posted.

#### Overriding date values
---
All date and time used in this postman collection are generated dynamically when we post a new freight order. Overriding those values is a little tricky but possible.

e.g. if we want to change the `LOAD_BEGIN`'s `BusinessExpectedDateTime`, instead of passing the variable `LOAD_BEGIN_BusinessExpectedDateTime`
we can directly pass the date/time (in this format `2021-05-22T12:20:00.000Z`). After that we must change the value of `LOAD_BEGIN_BusinessExpectedDateTime` in postman's environment variable with the actual value that we have overridden with.

The above case is only applicable while overriding values in Create freight order payload. For events we can directly replace the variables with timestamp values.

Event : unload_end of Container (FULL) at Transshipment Port
Event : load_begin of Container (FULL) at Transshipment Port
Event : load_end of Container (FULL) at Transshipment Port

Event : geoloc updates

//Geoloc Updates after departure from transshipment port

request.description:
# Geolocation Updates

There are a total of 17 geolocation updates that are covered in this collection, starting from Port Of Hamburg to an intermediate stop - Port of Lisbon and ending at the Port of New York.

The geolocation latitudes and longitudes are stored in variables named as "GEO-LOC_01-Latitude" and "GEO-LOC_01-Longitude" respectively. These locations can be changed by altering the values of the respective latitude and longitude variables.

Although, on changing the location latitude and longitude will directly affect the path displayed in the **Map View** of the Freight Booking.

item.name: Event : arrival of Vessel at Port of Discharge
Event : unload_begin of Container (FULL) at Port of Discharge
Event : unload_end of Container (FULL) at Port of Discharge
Event : arrival of Truck (EMPTY) at Port of Discharge
Event : gatein_start of Truck (EMPTY) at Port of Discharge
Event : gatein_end of Truck (EMPTY) at Port of Discharge
Event : load_begin of Container (FULL) at Port of Discharge
Event : load_end of Container (FULL) at Port of Discharge
Event : gateout_start of Truck(LOADED) at Port of Discharge
Event : gateout_end of Truck(LOADED) at Port of Discharge
Event : departure of Truck(LOADED) from Port of Discharge
Delete FO

<SOAP-ENV:Envelope xmlns:SOAP-ENV="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:SOAP-ENC="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">

            <TransportationOrderGenericTrackedProcess actionCode="05" changeOrdinalNumberValue="1">
                <CategoryCode>BO</CategoryCode>
                <ShippingTypeCode>3</ShippingTypeCode>
                <MovementTypeCode>1</MovementTypeCode>
                <CargoGrossWeightTotalQuantity unitCode="KGM">8140.0</CargoGrossWeightTotalQuantity>
                <CargoGrossVolumeTotalQuantity unitCode="MTQ">1.5</CargoGrossVolumeTotalQuantity>
                <PiecesTotalQuantity unitCode="EA">2.0</PiecesTotalQuantity>

request.description:
#### Changing Carrier or Shipper
---
Carrier and shipper can be changed from environment variables. For carrier we have `CARRIER_LBN` variable and for shipper we have `SHIPPER_LBN_ID` variable.

#### Changing Source and Destination locations
---
**Source Location:** In the XML payload we have a property called `<MainLoadingLocation>` which contains the details of the location.
- `<InternalID>`: value comes from the variable `SOURCE_LOC_EXT_ID` and `DEST_LOC_EXT_ID` maintained in environment variable. Make sure the environment variable's value get changed because it is reused while posting events.
- `<Address>`: this field needs to be filled manually while changing locations.
**Destination Location:** In the XML payload we have a property called `<MainUnloadingLocation>` which contains the details of the location.
- `<InternalID>`: value comes from the variable `SOURCE_LOC_EXT_ID` and `DEST_LOC_EXT_ID` maintained in environment variable. Make sure the environment variable's value get changed because it is reused while posting events.
- `<Address>`: this field needs to be filled manually while changing locations.

***NOTE***: If location is not present in location master app it will be created when the FO will be posted.

#### Overriding date values
---
All date and time used in this postman collection are generated dynamically when we post a new freight order. Overriding those values is a little tricky but possible.

e.g. if we want to change the `LOAD_BEGIN`'s `BusinessExpectedDateTime`, instead of passing the variable `LOAD_BEGIN_BusinessExpectedDateTime`
we can directly pass the date/time (in this format `2021-05-22T12:20:00.000Z`). After that we must change the value of `LOAD_BEGIN_BusinessExpectedDateTime` in postman's environment variable with the actual value that we have overridden with.

The above case is only applicable while overriding values in Create freight order payload. For events we can directly replace the variables with timestamp values.
